subject: Re: [cc-devel] wpLicense problem... please help
body:
Does this problem still occur with the 0.7.6.1 release from last week 
(http://techblog.creativecommons.org/2007/04/11/wplicense-076/)?

Nathan

shyam ganju wrote:
> i get the following error in the javascript console>>
> 
> Error: document.getElementById("license_options") has no properties
> Source File: http://soundvault.org/wp-content/plugins/wpLicense/admin.js
> Line: 7
> 
> any further advice??
> 
> shyam
> 
> On 05/04/2007, at 10:00 AM, Luis Villa wrote:
> 
>> On 4/4/07, Nathan R. Yergler > > wrote:
>>> On 4/4/07, shyam ganju >> > wrote:
>>> > umm, well when i hit the select link, the page reloads, but it 
>>> stays looking
>>> > exactly the same, so nothing happens when i hit the select link...
>>>
>>> If you go to "Tools" -> "Error Console" do you see any Javascript
>>> errors there?  I've not heard of that problem before.
>>>
>>> >
>>> > do you know of any wp plugins that allow individual posts to have 
>>> their own
>>> > license? or is wplicense the only plugin available?
>>>
>>> It's the only one I'm aware of; that doesn't mean another one I'm not
>>> aware of doesn't exist.  Maybe someone else on the list knows of
>>> something.
>>
>> There is one other one:
>> http://www.g-loaded.eu/2006/01/14/creative-commons-configurator-wordpress-plugin/
>>
>> But I don't think it allows per-post licensing either.
>>
>> Luis
>>
>>
> 
> shyam ganju
> www.kingfelix.net
> 
>
